unnormalised: Local NGO, 'Helping Hands,' received a rather… *interesting* donation this week. Seems someone, let's call him Mr. Sharma (for privacy, of course), accidentally donated Rs. 50,000 intended for his daughter's lavish Bollywood-themed birthday bash. He thought he was paying the caterer!
normalised: Local N-G-O, 'Helping Hands,' received a rather… *interesting* donation this week. Seems someone, let's call him Mister Sharma (for privacy, of course), accidentally donated rupee fifty thousand intended for his daughter's lavish Bollywood-themed birthday bash. He thought he was paying the caterer!

unnormalised: Turns out, hitting 'donate' instead of 'pay' on UPI at 2:00 AM after celebrating a bit *too* enthusiastically at his cousin's sangeet wasn't his brightest idea. Poor chap woke up to find his bank account lighter and 'Helping Hands' richer.
normalised: Turns out, hitting 'donate' instead of 'pay' on U-P-I at two A-M after celebrating a bit *too* enthusiastically at his cousin's sangeet wasn't his brightest idea. Poor chap woke up to find his bank account lighter and 'Helping Hands' richer.

unnormalised: The NGO, initially bewildered by the sudden windfall, discovered the mix-up when a frantic Mr. Sharma called, practically begging for his money back. He explained the situation with a mix of embarrassment and a very, *very* loud voice.
normalised: The N-G-O, initially bewildered by the sudden windfall, discovered the mix-up when a frantic Mister Sharma called, practically begging for his money back. He explained the situation with a mix of embarrassment and a very, *very* loud voice.

unnormalised: 'Helping Hands,' bless their cotton socks, decided to return Rs 45,000 but kept Rs 5,000 as a 'humble contribution'. They joked it was a 'tax' for donating while in a state of 'high spirits'. Mr. Sharma, though initially grumpy, eventually saw the funny side – after realizing his daughter’s party fund was still intact enough to secure a D-list Bollywood celebrity appearance!
normalised: 'Helping Hands,' bless their cotton socks, decided to return rupee forty five thousand but kept rupee five thousand as a 'humble contribution'. They joked it was a 'tax' for donating while in a state of 'high spirits'. Mister Sharma, though initially grumpy, eventually saw the funny side – after realizing his daughter’s party fund was still intact enough to secure a D-list Bollywood celebrity appearance!

unnormalised: So, folks, moral of the story? Always double-check your UPI transactions, especially after midnight chai. And maybe, just maybe, a small, tipsy donation isn't the worst thing in the world. 'Helping Hands' is now planning to use the Rs. 5000 to buy mosquito nets in some rural parts of Bihar. Every little bit helps, even if it’s slightly... accidental.
normalised: So, folks, moral of the story? Always double-check your U-P-I transactions, especially after midnight chai. And maybe, just maybe, a small, tipsy donation isn't the worst thing in the world. 'Helping Hands' is now planning to use the rupee five thousand to buy mosquito nets in some rural parts of Bihar. Every little bit helps, even if it’s slightly... accidental.
